intro: Vincetoxicum kitagawae, commonly known as Japanese snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Vincetoxicum kitagawae is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides.
